website_summaries.verdict: More substantial than similar single-high airbeds. Comfortable enough to use for long-term houseguests.
pros: Comfortable, even for larger individuals, up to 300 lbs
Built-in electric pump inflates and deflates in about 3 minutes
Waterproof flocked top with double-layered wave vinyl beam interior construction
cons: Sometimes has a strong smell at first, but it dissipates

website_summaries.verdict: Airbeds with built-in pillows are very popular with sleepers who seek additional support and height. This is a great alternative to uncomfortable pull-out couches or floor pallets.
pros: Includes a fast inflating electric pump
Flocked surface with grooves for fitted sheets
cons: Chemical odor, needs a period of degassing on arrival

customer_reviews.title: Seam split leaving large air bubble
customer_reviews.text: I have used the mattress for approximately three weeks. One of the seams has popped out, so to speak (not leaking), and it appears as a huge air bubble.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck III

customer_reviews.title: Drum Corp Mom says buy it!
customer_reviews.text: So fantastic I bought a second one! Easy inflate and deflate, stores beautifully and stays inflated all night. My son and I use these to sleep on cold gym floors while we are living in schools during drum corp season. They are high enough off the ground we never get cold and set up is a FAST piece of cake. Stop looking....you won't find anything nicer and more reliable for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M. Thrush

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 Chance It'll Work
customer_reviews.text: All of the other reviews are accurate. I ordered 2 of these airbeds - 1 of them inflated & stayed inflated with no problem; the other one would not stay inflated so I returned it (didn't buy another one). So your chance is literally 50/50 that you get an functioning airbed...There's definitely a quality control or production problem that needs to be fixed
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Went out and manufacturer wants me to pay shipping.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. The seams came up in the center and there was a huge lump in the middle. I checked out their manufactures warranty and that sucks too. It was only used a few times and I consider this a manufacturing flaw. Unfortunately I was outside of amazons exchange policy so I can't go through amazon. They only have a 30 day warranty and I have to payshipping. I just bought one from a different brand. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.title: Meets Our Needs
customer_reviews.text: While I can't attest to how comfortable it is since I've yet to use it, my 10 y/o laid down on it & fell asleep within minutes! She said it's very comfortable. We needed an air mattress for an emergency situation, and thankfully this one was available for Prime Same-day Shipping, and at $22, it can't be beat! I love the built-in electric pump!
customer_reviews.author: HMCN7604

customer_reviews.title: Gone to the Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great spare bed for grandchildren who may come to visit. It has also been used by 2 different adult guests who claimed to have one of the best away from home rests they have had in a long time. It holds the air well. Once stretched, it appears to maintain adequate treasure for weeks, at least to the touch. Finally, when not being used by a visitor, my dog has laid claim to the air mattress and can be found lounging on the bed more oft than not. Yes the bedding needs to be changed more frequently ... but we love our pooch and she loves the bed. ps: The sheets and bedding stay on quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle II

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable, extremely practical.
customer_reviews.text: Had five grandkids visit, aged six to twenty, that used these for three days. They hit the beds and slept for at least ten hours every night, they were so comfortable. I can't testify as to the usefulness of the built-in "pillow", since they used regular pillows. Word of advice: follow the directions. Inflate fully, let it sit overnight to allow the vinyl to stretch, then inflate some more to adjust. A third, minor adjustment may be necessary, but I didn't find that to be the case. BTW, I mass near 300 pounds, and the bed was comfortable for me also when I tested it. Storage is extremely convenient, as these roll up into a compact package. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: great unknown

customer_reviews.title: Look for Something Else
customer_reviews.text: I've rarely given anything a one-star review. I bought this airbed six months ago for myself (~100 lbs). Despite the "hit or miss" reviews, I decided to give it a chance. Even after following the directions and other reviews to give the product time to stretch, the bed continued to deflate and had to be re-inflated every 2-3 hours...so I conclude that it's not a matter of stretching, but a problem with leakiness. In addition, 4 months into using it, a seam in the middle of the mattress came apart, so now there's an uneven lump in the middle, effectively rendering this product unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: Great bed! I am impressed! At least for the 1st week. After than, it constantly goes flat.
customer_reviews.text: original review Great bed! I am impressed! One of my cats has claimed it and she now sleeps with me. She has never done this before. I assess the best is also that comfortable for her :) after just one week of use, it will longer hold air. It must be aired up every few hours or sizable deflation occurs. Not really good to sleep on if you plan to sleep for more than two hours. The reviews either seem to be really really good, or one star. So I assess that it is a supply issue. I am getting ready to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Valley

customer_reviews.title: It was a great air mattress
customer_reviews.text: It was a great air mattress... while it lasted. I only had it for 3ish months. I took really good care of it to make sure there was nothing on ground before I set it up. Lasted about a month before a tiny, but manageable, hole appeared and only three months until it was completely unusable. My experience may have been a fluke, but I am an extremely clean person and there is never any excess on my floors, so not sure how it got a hole that easily/quickly. In the meantime, I have had a cheap, tiny air mattress from Walmart that has held up better/longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTING
customer_reviews.text: I am SO disappointed in this bed!! I bought it to use over the Christmas period while I had family I town and it deflated every single night it was used!! I have a Queen sized one already which I have never had any issue with, but this single one is AWFUL, even for a person of 128lbs... a total waste of money!! Might as well have slept on the floor!!
customer_reviews.author: Liz A.

customer_reviews.title: OK for a guest bed - Don't overinflate!
customer_reviews.text: This is a super cheap air mattress. I think for what I paid, it was a decent value. It's designed for occasional use for guests, not a "sleep on it for a month" type situation. My son used it for going to friends' houses for sleepovers, and it was great for that. We also had a guest in from out of town who used it. The flocking on the top keeps the sheet from moving around. Unfortunately, one night I accidentally over-inflated and blew up the inside, so there's a huge bubble. The next night, another part of the inside burst, and the bubble grew. Now it's unusable, and just tips you right off.
customer_reviews.author: GemOfAGirl

customer_reviews.title: I liked the smaller size too
customer_reviews.text: Quality mattress. Just what I needed for guest in my small apartment. Even tho it's a twin, the added height does in fact help with comfort and function. It's right at couch seat height too which helped to act as an ottoman while it was inflated. I liked the smaller size too, which allowed the inflated mattress not take up so much room. AND the deflated mattress didn't take up so much room while being stored. Definitely worth the price. so cheap! and the built in pump worked great! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: dpolk

customer_reviews.title: Kids will Love this Bed & so Will you!
customer_reviews.text: We do a fair bit of traveling with our two kids and a single hotel room can be a challenge when one of your kids is a "wild" sleeper. You know the type that kicks, moves around, generally keeps you awake with their cold feet touching your back... Enter this bed. It has a built in inflator. Turn the knob one direction and the bed inflates. Turn the knob the other direction and it deflates. Fabulous. Easy setup/take down. The storage case isn't made with 1mm tolerances with a perfect fold thank god, so putting it away isn't a frustration. Worth the money, would recommend. Everyone gets their own bed, no sharing. Sleep-o-rific!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen L. Lange

customer_reviews.title: Great guest bed (and bed to banish the significant other ...
customer_reviews.text: Great guest bed (and bed to banish the significant other to in times of turmoil) We've had this bed for over 6 months now and it has never leaked - we keep it inflated all the time. Only periodically do we have to refill a little air and there have been no issues working the pump. The bed stays firm overnight as we've never had to re-pump air into this bed the following morning. I loved this bed so much I purchased the queen sized version of it when that went on sale. Looking forward to upgrading to that bed
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: Leakage after two months' use caused by product defect
customer_reviews.text: After less than two months' use there is a crack on the surface leaking air outside. I swear I did not put anything sharp on the bed. And the leak is not from any hole or user-caused damage on the surface, it comes from the connecting line on the surface. (Refer to the photo) And this leak happened when I was sleeping on it, 2 am.....I'm 180 pounds, better to lose some weight next time..... I checked the warranty, there is only a 30 days' warranty. So sad. Maybe I'm just unlucky to get some product with defects.
customer_reviews.author: Xi Liu

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it at the last minute when my younger daughter bought a friend along on a trip and we ended up short on sleeping room at the hotel. Rather then count on a cot we bought this along and it worked out fantastic! Short inflation time, the bed was plenty firm and comfortable while compact enough to fit in the room. The best part was that we easily got it back in the carry bag the next morning!! Bingo!! When does that ever happen? Recommend seems like a great value also for the quality!
customer_reviews.author: AJTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Stopped holding air after 3 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first week or so, took it on one camping trip and was comfortable. But now it won't retain air longer than a couple of hours. Inflates just fine, no noticeable leaks, but next thing you know it's maybe 50% inflated. Would only recommend it if you need a cheap air mattress for one time use, doesn't seem to hold up for much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: geminigrey

customer_reviews.title: It folds compact easily, it blows up quick and efficiently
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for nights i have to sleep at work. It folds compact easily, it blows up quick and efficiently! I love the plug in inflation system! It deflates quickly and easily also. The first one was defective and returning it for a replacement was a breeze! The second came quickly and was perfect. I'm still playing with it but so far i find it uncomfortable. I've tried inflating it to normal pressure, deflating it a little.. Guessing i am just too old for an air mattress. The kids love it and sleep peacefully on it. I would definitely recommend this mattress. Great for the value and the built in pump is worth its weight in gold!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GUEST BED SOLUTION
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two twin mattresses. Perfect solution to our tiny space need for guest beds. Our two adult sons were coming to visit for the holidays and our family downsized since they were gone so they needed to share small bedrooms with the younger siblings in their rooms. Not much space to work with and these were the perfect solution. One son is a football player who has back pain issues and he can sleep on this for 2 weeks and not complain. He’s a speed/skill player so he’s not a big lineman or anything, regular height and weight guy. Both sons are about 5’10 and under 200 lbs and both were comfortable. Great value
customer_reviews.author: Cali Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel & if you have guests over often!
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this for my apartment while I was waiting for a mattress, but I ended up keeping it for any guests I had over. I also ended up bringing it with me on trips when my friends & I would rent a house, so I didn't have to sleep on the floor lol + because it's tall, it actually feels like a bed. The pump is attached, & it both inflates & deflates in a decent amount of time. Honestly didn't think I would get as much use out of this as I did, & I really think it's an essential!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Dumadag

customer_reviews.title: Fast inflation!
customer_reviews.text: Gone are the days when you have to hand pump air mattresses. This stays in my trunk because we travel a lot with 3 kids and instead of getting a hotel with a couch my kids prefer to just bring this mattress along and sleep on it instead! They say its more comfortable. It comes in its own little carrying sack with a handle so its easy to tote around and its hard to deflate and fold up. The height is also great because you dont feel like you are crawling off the floor like old school traditional mattresses. You will never sink to the floor with this one!~
customer_reviews.author: Vacuum Vixen

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bed literally at the last minute as I am a nurse and was being called in for Hurricane Irma. It arrived next day as promised. The best $ I ever spent! Easy instructions and inflated in about 2 minutes. I did not experience any air loss and I thought it was very comfy for an air mattress - I slept on it 3 nights. Deflate was a snap and easily folded to fit inside it's storage bag. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shark Nurse

customer_reviews.title: and had great reviews (but the price went up) and found this ...
customer_reviews.text: this was a birthday present to my nephew. He had to throw away his sofa bed. and was sleeping on the floor. I mentioned why he didnt buy a airbed. He went down and got the 4inch camping airbed which he had to hand pump. So I had bought a different Intex Airbed before..and had great reviews (but the price went up) and found this one. He is now 16inches off the floor and getting a good night sleep. And he doesnt have to and pump this one. just plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: C. Burton

customer_reviews.title: Whole after 7 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The first few weeks of me having this bed I would have rated this product 4.5 stars. It took a little more than a week to properly stretch. I didn't mind giving it a short burst to refill it. Last night it actually got a 1 cm whole near the stitching. I didn't play with sharp objects near it and it was under where I put pillows. It lasted me 7 weeks without a problem. I'll try and patch and hope the patch sticks. Update 2 Months and 3 patches later. All in the same spot at the top seem.
customer_reviews.author: ThurmanJ

customer_reviews.title: Your guest may want to stay longer!
customer_reviews.text: Moved up from a single mattress which requires an external pump. (used at camp) Purchased 2 Intex Pillow Rest Raised Airbeds for expected holiday guest. This 'double' height is great for weekend guest. Easy to sit down and get up from on the floor. The internal pump worked great. Lost very very little air and only one, added air for an extra firm friend. The mattress folded up, taking care to expel all air while flatting the bed and placing it into the storage bad.
customer_reviews.author: BRR50

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Can t beat this bed for the price. Built in pump works great. Takes only a few minutes to inflate. I go about 250lbs and it stays firm and very comfortable. You do need to inflate / deflate it a few times before you use it the first time. This stretches it and keeps it firm when you do lay on it the first time. Also easy to deflate and repack.
customer_reviews.author: Frank M.

customer_reviews.title: the good the bad and the ugly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of the twin mattresses 13 months ago and took them out of the boxes for the first time 4 days ago. The good: very easy and fast to pump up. The bad: one of them deflated shortly after pumping. The ugly: We pumped the bed three more times before it was used by a 6 year old. When he used it for one night he slept on a bed that couldn't hold air. So one bed is good and the other bed is useless. Way past the 90 day warranty. Would not purchase or recommend this bed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in September for when we have guests over. Used every other week until December, when it has bern used daily since. My brother is 275 lbs and uses this as a bed for the meantime. He loves the way it feels on his achey back. Seams are still holding strong. This item has not once fully deflated. He has had to occasionally to put some air (every other week) in it to maintain the level of firmness he enjoys. I'm buying a 2nd one to have on hand for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain_shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great until you wake up on the floor in a deflated bed!
customer_reviews.text: Positives: easy to blow up and comfortable. Negatives: developed small holes along seam within a few days of use. I thought it was something me or my kids did... ordered another twin size and straight out of the box I inflated it and could hear hissing from escaping air and immediate deflating. Had the same issue with the Queen size version. In total we purchased 4 of these (three twin size and one queen size) and only ONE could hold air consistently after a few days use.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for every night mattress
customer_reviews.text: We had to return the first one we received, because the pump was letting the air leak out. After around three weeks the second mattress had a baffle inside detach, so one side of the bed puffed up higher than the other. Amazon cheerfully replaced the first mattress with the second one. We didn't bother returning the second one even though it had only been three weeks. It might be a good mattress for occasional use, but we needed something for every night. It might just have been to much to ask of an air mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Laura of Harvest Lane Cottage

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away from this bed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bed exactly one month ago, great product at first, but, now the bed seems to have blown a chamber. Looks like it is pregnant due to the bulge in the middle. I am 5'2 and weigh less than 120 lbs., so I do believe this would indicate a defect within this bed. Will stay away from this brand in the future, very very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Great Air Mattress
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 twin mattresses for a 5 day "glamping" trip. These were so easy to inflate. I put a king matterss cover then my sheet set and quilt on and it looked just like a mini version of my bed at home. My husband and 65lb. Dog and I all slept soundly on our comfy Glamping Bed for 5 nights. About every other morning I would plug them in and blow up a bit more and they were fine. The ease at deflating was suprising as well. Definately worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DebJS

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air through pump vent
customer_reviews.text: Within the first week it began to deflate over night to the point that whoever was sleeping on it was on the ground by the morning. We have checked it thourally several times for a rip or small terror in the mattress but have come to the conclusion that it simply leaks air out of the seal. I would not buy this again, but personally with experience all air mattresses are terrible thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Deflated after the first night
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what to say. I bought this for a friend as a gift, before I came to stay with her in her new apt. The first night it worked fine, and then it started to deflate through the night. As it was brand-new, I can't imagine why that would be. But it doesn't bode well.I guess if I was staying there longer and had the time I could try diagnose the problem and try fix it, but....I shouldn't have to, it seems to me.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Loses air overnight
customer_reviews.text: This comes in handy for when we have big gatherings and need an extra bed, but after only a couple uses, it loses air way too quickly now. I've had it for a while but have only really used it maybe 10-15 times, but now it loses air overnight. I'm not sure if there's a hole off something but I feel that it shouldn't be losing this much air that quickly. Sad because it's actually quite comfortable and so easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: ss.lee

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, easy to inflate, and easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I bought this air bed for my grandson to sleep on when he came to visit. He loved it! It is super comfortable, easy to inflate/deflate and can be easily stored when not in use. I followed the advice on the package and inflated it a day or so before I needed it, then added a little more air. It is months later and is still inflated nicely! This is a great, comfortable air bed when you need an extra bed!
customer_reviews.author: luvmoovies

customer_reviews.title: I think I'll look at cots next...
customer_reviews.text: It was good bed, I used it once a week & sometimes not at all. I didn't realize it was 3 years old until one night one of the interior supports popped & it almost threw me off the bed, I almost had a heart attack being sound asleep. I guess 3 years isn't a bad lifespan for an air mattress but I'd rather a slow leak than a scary explosion! Lol Sorry I should have taken a picture it was pretty crazy looking, it almost looked pregnant !
customer_reviews.author: G. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Nice While It Lasted
customer_reviews.text: It started out as a good mat and then it started leaking. It was something that could be put up with. The final straw was when a chamber blew out it's center seam with a big bang. After it blew out, it left a big bulge in the center of the mat. The bulge was big enough that it wasn't possible to lay on the mat. I kept rolling off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Great.
customer_reviews.text: This worked wonderfully for a few weeks, then all suddenly two of the "creases" on top let loose at the hem and bubbled up on the left side, causing the right side to deflate and topple my daughter off the side of the bed as she was sleeping. I thought if I spent a little more money versus purchasing a $25 air mattress it would last us at least a couple of months, but apparently that's not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Moore

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: For the twin size I'm 270 lbs and this held up very well on every day use for about a month until i got an actual bed. Gave it to someone who was 310 lbs and it only lasted for about a week longer and messed up. Our fault for exceeding weight limit to be fair. But i love how easy it was to use and put away. The built in pump was a major plus and game changer. All around great product no complaints whatsoever. Will be buying again for smaller guests who stay over!
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and practical
customer_reviews.text: Since I have trouble with Sciatica, this worked out better than sleeping in the bed in the motel we stayed at when we went to the shore for our anniversary weekend. I hated not sleeping in the bed with my husband, but it was so hard that we blew up the bed in minutes and I slept better than I had ever slept in months. It will come in handy as well as an extra bed whenever we have any overnight guests (which we don't usually have too often). It did lose a little bit of air during the night, but was told to expect this. Otherwise, I would definitely recommend it to anyone and everyone. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: bedazzled

customer_reviews.title: Small pin hole
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my grandson, to use during Holiday visits. After one use (right at Thanksgiving) pin hole in product and my grandson only weighs 114 lbs, but having to pump up bed every day to be use at night, because it goes flat. Will have to see if this can be repaired, since return time passed. Over all, bed was perfect size, height and comfortable to sleep on if only air would stay in the bed. Price at time of purchase was good also. Does anyone have suggestions how to fix pin hole?
customer_reviews.author: Catssmor2013Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: This mattress is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: We purchased the intex Pillow Rest Raised Air bed as an extra bed for our Grandchild. The bed required us to pump it up two or three times per week. Suddenly the seams began to burst. Rheya found ways to sleep in the bed until the whole bed was shaped like a strangely shaped ball. I’ve replaced the mattress now with one that holds air and has a different seam pattern. I give the Pillow Rest one star because it lasted three months. We didn’t have to return it the first week. I will never purchase an Intex product again.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mattress. We have had several sizes. Comfortable and easy to inflate and deflate. The built in air pump is a super plus. They really last (if your grandson doesn't use it as a trampoline). I have back issues and the 16 in. height makes it much easier to get up. Great prices. Definitely would recommend this mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Tammey Foster

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and comfy
customer_reviews.text: These are great and super affordable! My mom and brother are visiting, and I only have one couch. They have reported this air mattress is super comfy and maintains its firmness. We've topped it up a bit every couple of days, but that isn't a hassle at all since the pump is built in. Very pleased with this purchase, and the price is definitely right. The twin-sized air mattresses at the nearby Target were a starting price of $40 - without a built in pump and not raised (i.e., only 1 layer). This is a great value. They've held up well for a week of sleeping and a cat jumping on it and hopefully will stay like that over time.
customer_reviews.author: AJ, The Original

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly and bad knees
customer_reviews.text: Like all airbeds, it needs reinflating if used on multiple nights but it will not severely leak as to leave you on the floor by morning. Personally, I despise the battery powered inflators. I use manual, piston pumps. Got to work the biceps and show off to the company. But the outlet blew it up in 2 minutes, this is a deal-maker. This is also great for the minimalist wanting to increase their living space by removing their bed.
customer_reviews.author: COA×4Top Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Fast inflation!
customer_reviews.text: Edit: It hasn’t even been a month and the mattress starts to lose air in the middle of the night. This is a problem for me because I bought it for my 6 year old step son to sleep on once a week. I plan on using soap bubbles to find the leak(s) but a pain to do for a brand spankin new one! I haven’t bought an automatic inflatable air mattress in almost 20 years (dang I am getting old...) and boy, has technology improved! The mattress inflates in half the amount of time and the built in pillow is a plus too!
customer_reviews.author: Christa

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this awhile ago and put it away for when I needed it. I just pulled it out of the box for the first time a couple months ago, and pumped it up. A few hours later it was losing air. I tried using it again another time, and the same thing happened. Too late to return it, but it was a total waste of money. You would think they would test these things before selling them. I would suggest to anyone who buys one to inflate it as soon as you get it home to make sure it holds air.
customer_reviews.author: Snow White

customer_reviews.title: updated review not worth to buy
customer_reviews.text: not a bad buy for 20 bucks. great height, like other make sure you blow it up before use and let it set over night, then fill it again. i bought two for those nights for sleep overs. Updated review after a few months of use the seam split on one of them in two separate spots so was like sleeping on a bubble. The second one just started losing air for no reason. Yes i checked to make sure it was closed all the way and all that jazz. Short lived product will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kryme2sleep

customer_reviews.title: Great blow-up bed
customer_reviews.text: Great blow-up bed. My grandson uses it when he comes over. He says it is really comfortable. A small fitted sheet fits on it perfectly and stays put. I bought a small storage box and everything including sheets fit inside. Folds up so easy with the electric button you push to remove the air. Folds into 3rds. I can carry the box with us when we travel if we need additional sleeping. This is really a nice blow-up air mattress. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect twin air mattress
customer_reviews.text: THis air mattress is EXACTLY what we wanted. We were looking for something small enough to go in a bedroom, but comfortable enough for my teenager to use as needed. It's easy up and easy down are even better. AND, it's easy enough for him to put back in the carrying bag, which isn't always possible. We have not taken it out of the house, but it could easily be transported to a hotel if needed. We don't camp, so I can't help you with that...LOL. Great purchase and I would purchase it again if I had the need. You will not be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: T. Cagan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to get by in a temporary living situation. I've had it for 2 months and I'm still sleeping on it nightly. I caught it on sale and it was a fantastic buy. It can be difficult to keep sheets on it and the ripples on it take some getting used to, but I have no regrets in purchasing this product. Absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: GRM

customer_reviews.title: Good build quality !
customer_reviews.text: It is a well made air bed , we have used it for almost a year now. When we first got it my son didn't understand that you inflate it and let it sit overnight for the first time and go back and put air in later after it has stretched a bit. But he overinflated it and it got a pinhole , so we patched it up and he has been using ever since !
customer_reviews.author: Kenno25

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mattress for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this air mattress since December 2015 and use it about a handful of times per year. I’ve never had any issues with it. It’s slightly deflated by the time I wake up in the morning but defintiely still comfortable enough to get a good nights sleep. My only complaint is a wish it were a little more comfortable in general and wish it was easier to 100% deflate and fold up. It’s hard to fit it back in it’s bag. Overall, I think it’s great for what it is and you can’t beat the cost. I’m actually thinking about purchasing a second one.
customer_reviews.author: cma

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, great supportive bed!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 yr old nephews came to stay with me for 1 month. I bought two of these so that I could have my guest room back after they leave. I asked them every day "did you sleep well?" and each day they said they slept so good! These boys are picky and would tell me the truth. The instructions said that after 3 days you will need to inflate the bed again, being that it will lose air. But that was not the case for us. It works super good, very comfortable. It holds the sheets very well. I recommend this bed so much, that I came back to buy a 3rd LOL Thumbs UP
customer_reviews.author: Jessica H

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Well, it certainly was good value, while it lasted. Like many reviewers, mine developed a leak, after not too many uses (less than 10? 20?). But while it worked, it was fine. Sooo, I need a new one, and am actually considering getting this again, as I don't plan to use it too often. Logically I should probably pay more and have it last... but if you don't plan on using it often, and need it for the occasional guest or emergency situation, can't argue with the price. (I also purchased a SoundAsleep queen and have had no issues with that, so I would probably recommend that one over this if you don't mind spending the extra $)
customer_reviews.author: basstub

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Easy To Inflate!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item a while ago for Labor Day weekend with the Grandchildren. Just used it this weekend and they loved it. It didn't take long to inflate, you just plug it in and it self-inflates, nice height and has built-in pillow! My only concern is long term use, people complain that the seams leak on air mattresses in general, so I hope this brand is well-made.
customer_reviews.author: D. Boggs

customer_reviews.title: 2 were great, 1 had a very small leak that I ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 4 of these in one order. 2 were great, 1 had a very small leak that I used the patch kit to fix. The 4th has a leak that I have spent way to much time trying to find but cannot and it will not hold air more than 15 minutes. As I am using these to stage a home it is not possible to refill it every time I have a walk through! I have purchased many an Intex inflatable mattress over the years but have never had 50% have leaks. Will look for another brand in the future
customer_reviews.author: the inadvertent farmer

customer_reviews.title: both were quite comfortable and i don't want to bother with a real ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a few months until it sprang a leak..i taped up what i thought was the leak but it still loses too much air. I bought another intex similar one..that blew out the baffles or something so one side was a foot higher than the other. both were quite comfortable and i don't want to bother with a real bed since i might move soon..but two out of two were bad. they do inflate very nicely and are quite nice to sleep on...i can not recommend them for durability. i presume i have passed any sort of warranty limit by now on both of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Packable Bed
customer_reviews.text: Our family loves this bed. We purchased a couple of them, and we use them during sleepovers. The built-in pump inflates the bed very firm, and it holds the pressure for the night. The bed comes with a storage bag. I'm 6'1" and weigh 180lb, and the bed is comfortable thru the night.
customer_reviews.author: MarioV73

customer_reviews.title: Works well, very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this nightly for the last few days as a test before I use it in my camper and I really like it. It did deflate a small amount at first but that issue did clear up. There is a tag on it that says the fabric need to stretch and that seems to be true. It is very comfortable and I love the fact that the pillow end is raised, this helps to keep your pillow on the bed and it doesn't slide off like a flat mattress does.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak, woke up sleeping on floor
customer_reviews.text: This bed has really mixed reviews, but I decided to take a chance as I have had good experience with this brand in the past. Unfortunately, not this time. We inflated the bed at home and allowed it to "stretch." However, whenever someone laid on it, there was a slow leak that we could not find. Returned bed for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Paley

customer_reviews.title: Ripped the first night of use at the stitching for the pillow
customer_reviews.text: So we bought this air mattress since I have to stay in the house we are selling until our settlement in a week while the rest of the family moves. The first night I sleep on this mattress the stitching where the "raised" pillow area breaks and puts a 1/4 in rip in the material right at the seem. So much for that air mattress. I was comfortable for a little while. I loved the self inflation pump however that does no good if the stitching rips and the all the air leaks out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bed (initially), but poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these inflatable beds immediately after Christmas and they initially performed very well. However, one of them has recently been deflating on its own, until there is no air the following morning -- making for a very uncomfortable rest. And, unfortunately, this problem occurred only 2 weeks after the manufacturer's 90 day warranty expired!! I will be replacing them with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to kids (takes a beating and doesn't leak)
customer_reviews.text: My youngest is a Type 1 diabetic and some nights require me to be up and down all night. On the bad nights, it is easier to put him in our bedroom, but the king-sized bed isn't big enough for two adults, two dogs and one 10 y/o. It inflates quickly and easily, is simple to clean and takes a beating. Truly. Dogs, kids, laundry, books, being kicked, slid and downright abused--nothing seems to affect it! Great for sleepovers for kids friends. Great value and fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea bad product.
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this to use during the last trimester of my partners preganncy. Our two year old sleeps in the bed with us, so I wanted to buy something I could sleep on; so they could get more restful sleep. Long story short I’ve had to patch the thing twice. Mind you, it doesn’t come with its own glue in the kit. Since then I’ve slept on the thing spiratically. I have to keep it plugged in now and refill it multiple times during the night, so I don’t wake up on the floor. Cools idea of a built in pump. Didn’t really execute the design properly. Terrible product, the warranty sucks. Stay away; buy from Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: ji26robe

customer_reviews.title: leaked after one night
customer_reviews.text: this air mattress sprung a leak and deflated after one night of sleeping on it. the first night was fine, but after the second, i woke up on the floor. i searched all over for the leak but couldn't find it. i suspect it was around the area where you attach the pump to inflate it, and i tried taping over the whole area after refilling the air mattress, but it still deflated after about an hour. i was camping in the middle of nowhere so i spent hours trying to fix it because i had no other option. no luck. horrible product, would never buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware! The company that sells this product claims ...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! The company that sells this product claims that the buyer must inflate the mattress repeatedly due to a "stretching" issue. The mattress was inflated REPEATEDLY on a recent camping trip. The mattress continued to lose air the entire three days I tried to use it. I'm not just talking about losing a bit of air . . . every three hours for three nights I awoke to a completely flat mattress and found myself on the hard ground. Every 3 hours I inflated the mattress, 3 hours later it was flat. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS MATTRESS UNDER ANY CONDITIONS. I am returning it today.
customer_reviews.author: Lady from Walnut Creek

customer_reviews.title: As Good as a Real Bed
customer_reviews.text: My 72-year-old father sleeps on this bed when he visits me because I don't have a second bed. He loves it. I find it very comfortable as well. The no-slip top keeps the sheets from sliding around. It blows up fast, but the motor is very noisy, so we have to remember to blow up the bed while it's still early. It holds its air well for several days and doesn't need to be topped off, so we leave it inflated for the duration of his visit. He's about 240 lbs, and it holds his weight without caving in or making it too hard for him to get up.
customer_reviews.author: L. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Lemon
customer_reviews.text: The documentation that comes with the bed says to be prepared for some stretching. I understand and get it. Having the bed go flat in 2 hours with a 2 year old sleeping on it is not understandable. I’m not going to search for the leak and patch it, like the documentation suggests. Im going to throw it away. I had high hopes but it turned out to be a let down.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE Intex!
customer_reviews.text: Great inflatable bed. I use it inside on carpet for guests. They do not lose much air at night (barely any). As long as you are careful with these beds (no jumping/ rough housing) they can last for awhile. A year is as long as I have made it with one. I have bought five all together (different sizes- I like the twins the best). (Sugestion: I use full sheets on my twin beds and king sheets on my queen/full beds. It makes the beds much easier to make and does not stretch the sheets out).
customer_reviews.author: BRat

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I don't love this air mattress as much as I hoped it would. I bought it due to the price, thinking it would be better than it is. It is small, which is part of it. I roll off the side all night and barely have enough room for my legs. I also didn't find this any more comfortable than a normal $25 air mattress. The only pro is that the air system is great. All you have to do it plug it in to fill and release. Takes no time at all and you don't need a separate pump.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Leaked after 2 inflations.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for camping. As recommended by the manufacturer's instructions, I inflated it and allowed the vinyl to stretch for a couple of hours before use. I then deflated it, rolled it up, and stored it in its included bag. The next week when I went to inflate the bed for camping (Note: this bed requires a 120VAC power source for the built in pump), it had developed a hole and deflated after a couple of hours. Sleeping on it was ridiculous as it constantly needed reinflation. I have returned this product and do not recommend it for any type of use.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Can not beat the price ! It was simple to plug it in ....pump air and deflate . After a few hours you may need to plug in for more air because it is stretching the plastic . No worries it is not losing air . I'd have to say it is very conveinant , does not take up too much space , easy to store , built in raised pillow , built in pump, good height from floor !!! Should I say more?!!! Great buy I purchased it for $20.00 plus free shipping !!! You will get your monies worth . Best wishes
customer_reviews.author: DashnFashn

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap bed alternative if you're on a tight budget
customer_reviews.text: This is a comfortable cheap bed. I had no issues with air deflation. I recommend getting a mattress topper to supplement this bed. You can find a halfway decent one for $20 if you're on a budget. Filling the bed with air is as simple as turning a knob. It takes less than 5 minutes for the bed to inflate. After using this for 5 months, I barely noticed any wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love you Amazon but this item should have been thrown ...
customer_reviews.text: This airbed was delivered to us full of holes. Unfortunately we did'nt look it over as soon as it arrived. We bought it for unexpected guests. We had some this past Tuesday and after inflating it according to directions it promptly lost air. My husband used the enclosed patch but there are more leaks all along the fold lines. We love you Amazon but this item should have been thrown in the trash. I guess it's true, if the deal is too good to be true it's NOT a good deal but a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product the first time I used it. But then....fast forward to less than a year old. It will not hold air overnight when my 120 lb daughter takes it to sleepovers. She has only used it 4 times. She has back problems so it is important that she doesn’t sleep on a cement floor. Last night she got a half hour sleep before she was laying on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable and easy to fill
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, this thing has held up to weekly sleepovers with middle School boys. It has never popped or sagged. It's comfortable and best of all I taught my son's friends how to fill it up by hitting the button and they don't bother me at all. When it's time to empty it they let the air out and put it away. I'm going to buy more it's great to have around
customer_reviews.author: boricuagoddess79

customer_reviews.title: A great value for a single person portable bed
customer_reviews.text: Some normal leakage but overall the performance overnight is acceptable. It is a convenient portable bed that is cheap but more comfortable than a folding cot or a sleeping bag. It is lighter weight and takes less storage space than a folding cot too. I bring this twin size airbed with me whenever I visit my daughter at her 1-bedroom apartment. Simply plug the electric cord to the wall, turn the dial to inflate, and watch it fill quickly. When you're ready to pack it again, plug the electric cord to the wall again, turn the dial to deflate, and watch it deflate on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina Lusterio

customer_reviews.title: It will fail sooner or later (hopefully later).
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many of these over the years. They all inevitably fail. Some after a couple months, they might last a year if you are lucky. I don't abuse them, don't drag them around. Just inflate, deflate, pack in the carrying bag. After a while, they start leaking and eventually don't make it through an entire night of sleep without my kids ending up on the floor. Sometimes an air chamber will break and they will develop a hump. The best thing I can say is that they are cheap. The cheap price keeps me coming back, but if you buy this, buy it knowing that it is a disposable item that will fail sooner or later (hopefully later).
customer_reviews.author: Louis Michael Honick

customer_reviews.title: Good Bed
customer_reviews.text: This is SUPER easy to inflate and easy to carry/transport when you need it. The negative is that it is hard to deflate enough to put in the bag. There seems to be an inner lining that covers the exit valve that can prevent it from deflating when it gets close to the end. I have to keep moving it around and pulling the material away from the pump and it still doesn't fully deflate. With some effort and work I get it back in the bag but I wont buy one again with an attached pump.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Of course not as good as my former memory foam
customer_reviews.text: Awesomeness! I am in my early 30s but have a back problem from a back injury a couple of years ago. But I do well on this airbed. Of course not as good as my former memory foam, but it is as good as an air mattress can get. Easy to inflate. This served me well during transition periods as an apartment hopper (grad student who changes housing quite often) Having this cutie as a fallback means that I no longer have to sleep on the floor because I had to sell the real mattress between the move!
customer_reviews.author: Y Hong

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mattress close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and priced well. My twin teen nieces (age 13) stayed at my home for two weeks and I only had to blow this mattress up about 3 times within the 2 weeks. It holds up well and the bag included is useful for staorage. The deflating feature is much better than many air mattresses I have purchased it the pass. This air mattress is comfortable and doesn’t loose air in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: MOM OF  3Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, this is junk
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with this air mattress until the ribbed “seams” on the top began to fail after four single night uses. Now there is a big bump in the middle. If you look in customer review pictures you will see that this seems to happen quite often. If you chance it anyway, it inflates and deflates writhing a couple of minutes and was otherwise comfortable. There is a built in compartment to store the cord. It has a carry bag which is convenient but seems kind of flimsy. The plastic itself doesn’t seem too sturdy. I have an aerobed and this is clearly of lesser quality. But for twenty dollars it was worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: JECA

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. I rarely complain about a product.... I'd rather report the positives. However, this was one of the very few real duds I've gotten from Amazon. We have only used this mattress a few times, and it has already begun to lose air. I don't know where the problem is, but my daughter's friend nearly ended up with rug burns because this thing totally deflated. I don't know what to advise because I looked at a lot of mattresses and their reviews and thought I was choosing a good one. No such luck .
customer_reviews.author: Caroline K. Reece

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. DO NOT BUY. After a few uses it started leaking. We cannot find the leak to patch it and we are about 3 weeks past the return date so we cant return it. It stays inflated about 2 hours. This product lasted a few uses by an 11 year old girl over about 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: madelin winget

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: If you want to spend money for one or two uses and then clog our landfills with this product, it's the bed for you. Intex customer support sounds very aware of how poor their product and could care less. The first time I used it it was great. But planned on getting more than one use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: We followed the directions on how to air it up a few times to allow it to stretch but it keeps loosing air but not like a leak in the plastic but more like the air valve is screwy. With no pressure on the mattress it deflates completely in a matter of hours. With pressure on the mattress it leaks slower and sometimes it doesn’t deflate at all it’s anyones guess if it won’t deflate or deflate leaving you on the ground. Not a good choice for camping.
customer_reviews.author: david jensen

customer_reviews.title: It is not really comfortable for the back
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bed in January 2018 as back up for our guest. We pack it back in the box after used for 3 days. we kept it in the closet then i open again yesterday because we have guest again . the bed is slowly deplating that we have to inflate again in the middle of the night. It is not really comfortable for the back. We have Queen size same brand for more than a year use more often, never have a problem and still holding air.
customer_reviews.author: The Oracle

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like this airbed because the air would not hold
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this airbed because the air would not hold. Bed had to be pumped on a daily basis. I bought it for my friend (110lbs) to use while she was in town visiting. Unfortunately she woke up sunk in the bed. I (95lbs) also tested it out but the results were the same. It has a twist & secure valve which is suppose to keep the air in but it did not work at all. This airbed was a last minute fix as my original Amazon order for a foldable guest bed was damaged & sent back before it had even reached me.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Developed a lengthwise bulge twice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item twice in twin size. Amazon replaced 1 of them in addition. They develop a hump/bulge lengthwise in the middle of the mattress and you can’t sleep comfortably on it. If not for that, it would be good. Love the height.
customer_reviews.author: Verdes

customer_reviews.title: it's pretty okay. The bed is comfortable and convenient for ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's pretty okay. The bed is comfortable and convenient for a night, but not longer than that. My mattress begins deflating after a few hours, and I find it's about 1/2 deflated after sleeping through the night. The plug-in air pump is super convenient, though it takes a LONG time to use to deflate again. Also, I realize this is supposed to be a twin bed, but it is SHORT--if you're taller than 5'8" you won't fit on this bed!
customer_reviews.author: A. Matson

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for a air mattress
customer_reviews.text: Bought for when my kids had friends spend the night. I have slept on it my self a couple of times and was very pleased with how comfortable it is for an air mattress. We have had it for almost a year now and through all the use it has held up fairly well. It is starting to leak a little now through the release but that could be just from kids jumping on it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The product was purchased for when my daughters come home, and they started leaking nearly a month in. The seams on the felt was leaking and because its on velvet, you cant repair it. I contacted the company and they told me they wouldn't replace them even though its clearly a manufacturing defect. I replaced them with a different brand. I wouldnt recommend the air mattress. I bought two and barely got a week with the amount of overnights that we had with the kids but they were leaking from the start but couldnt pin point where.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Miller

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased mine in January 2018 and it now has a leak in it. I spent $27 on it, but definitely would not spend the money they are asking for it now (unless it lasts a lot longer). I did notice it started to deflate after about 6 months of use, but I could still sleep pretty well. The last few months I did wake up and had to put in more air.
customer_reviews.author: Prime

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'll try to post a pic later if I can but looks just like what is advertised, comfortable but adding an extra comforter on top of the mattress makes it a bit more comfy. Dont over inflate it can bust and no the air doesn't stay in it for long but I'll say I had to re-inflate every three days which isnt bad also it literally takes about two minutes to inflate pretty quick just plug the cord in the wall and it does the rest for you!!
customer_reviews.author: Fran Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this on Halloween and it came the following ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on Halloween and it came the following week. That being said, until a month ago, I had no problems. The reason I have an issue isn't even the mattress' fault, one of my dogs jumped onto the bed from a higher point and his nail ripped a TINY hole on a seam. Since then, we've used this mattress several times, covering the hole with tape. It does deflate (obviously) but takes a few hours to do so. Thankfully, the person who uses it doesn't mind refilling it every few hours. This mattress is seriously a trooper, and I will be buying a replacement soon.
customer_reviews.author: Ophelia Amoret

customer_reviews.title: Great design. Bad materials. Won't hold air.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sad situation. The design of this bed is terrific. We took it on a trip and my son slept on it in our motel room. You just plug it in and flip the switch. It's brilliant. Except for one tiny problem. Every night it gained holes, despite our care in setting it up, until by the last night of a two week trip it wouldn't stay up even two hours. So we threw it away. It's cheap enough to do that, but it's really a shame that something that works so well is just so badly constructed. I would gladly pay another $20 if this would actually last. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Ebooker

customer_reviews.title: Great air mattress
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my mother who moved in with us, we've had it for about a month now and we love it! She loves it and no complaints yet, it fills up quickly and all she does is open the vent and set it aside and it deflates pretty quick too. My husband and I want one for us now for camping! Will definitely be getting another one!
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

product_meta.title: Intex Pillow Rest Raised Airbed with Built-in Pillow and Electric Pump, Twin, Bed Height 16.5"
product_meta.description:
If the airbed has a leak you can find it and patch it But first check for the following Stretching is a natural characteristic of new vinyl and the first few times you use the mattress, some stretching will occur suggesting that the mattress is losing air. It is simply stretching under your body weight and this is normal for the first few uses. To check the mattress for leaks, first make sure the valves are secure, replace it if necessary. You can also put liquid soap and water in a squirt bottle and spray on seams. If there is a leak it will bubble. (Laundry detergent and dishwasher detergent will not work; they do not have the "bubbling" effect) After you find the leak, clean and dry the leaking area, remove the flocking with fine sand paper or an emery board, then apply the repair patch that comes with your airbed. Alternatively, you may purchase an Intex repair kit (#59632) for additional patches.

AMAZON.COM
Offering all the benefits of the Intex Raised Downy airbed but with the added advantage of lighter weight and mid-rise height, the Intex Pillow Rest inflatable airbed is ideal for travelers who want the comforts of a bed but the convenience of a blow-up mattress. The Pillow Rest is equipped with a quality-tested, 20.8-gauge, waterproof flocked top, along with 15-gauge vinyl beams and 16-gauge sides and bottom. The resulting surface is comfortable and secure, whether you're sleeping at the in-laws' overcrowded house or setting up a guest bed in the basement. In addition, the Pillow Rest is remarkably easy to inflate thanks to the built-in, high-powered electric pump, which does its job in a mere three minutes. No more fussing with tiring hand or foot pumps or rummaging through the garage for your detached electric pump. And should the mattress feel a little too soft or firm, you can customize the comfort level with the touch of a button. 

The Pillow Rest is raised 17.5 inches from the floor, making it far taller than most inflatable mattresses, and includes built-in pillows for added comfort. And at 39by 16.5 by 75 inches (W x H x L), the mattress is an official twin size, making it a good fit for fitted sheets. The Pillow Rest--which offers a capacity of 300 pounds--comes with an AC power cord, a shoulder strap, and a duffel bag.



Regarding inflation:

Measurements will vary based on the manner in which it is inflated and packaging disclaims “approximate size”.

Airbeds are measured from the widest point including the beams (bulges) on the side and off the tallest point from the floor including built-in pillows if applicable.


Location, temperature, and humidity will affect the airbed’s firmness. Airbeds will need to be occasionally re-inflated (topped off) to maintain desired firmness when used for more than a few days as vinyl tends to relax over time.
feature_bullets: Inflatable twin airbed with built-in electric pump for home use
Waterproof flocked top with vinyl beams, sturdy construction, and built-in pillows for added comfort
High-powered, built-in pump makes inflation and deflation easy, inflates mattress in approximately 3 minutes
Double-layered wave beam interior construction, raised 16.5 inches from floor. Material: Nylon
Standard twin size - 39 x 16.5 x 75 (W x H x L) - great for fitted sheets, 300-Pound capacity
